conclusion: Determine the velocity v_1 of particles reaching the collection device.
Particles emitted from source S with charge-to-mass ratio q/m = 2 x 10^6 C/kg and magnetic field B = 5 x 10^-3 T.
Particles emitted in all directions in the first quadrant need to reach the collection device on positive x-axis.
Radius of circular path R = mv/qB.
Distance from source S to collection device is d = 1.2 m.
Particles travel in circular path such that path passes through collection device.
Use trigonometry: R sin θ = d.
Horizontal distance is R cos θ; particle must reach collection device.
Calculate velocity v_1 using relationship between radius, charge-to-mass ratio, and magnetic field.
Final calculation: v_1 = qBd/(m sin θ).
Given values: q/m = 2 x 10^6 C/kg, B = 5 x 10^-3 T, d = 1.2 m, sin θ = d/R.
